doc:
The uuid package generates and inspects UUIDs.

UUIDs are based on RFC 4122 and DCE 1.1: Authentication and Security Services.
name: uuid

consts.doc: Domain constants for DCE Security (Version 2) UUIDs.

types.doc: A Domain represents a Version 2 domain
types.name: Domain

types.doc:
A Time represents a time as the number of 100's of nanoseconds since 15 Oct
1582.
types.name: Time

funcs.doc:
GetTime returns the current Time (100s of nanoseconds since 15 Oct 1582) and
clock sequence as well as adjusting the clock sequence as needed.  An error
is returned if the current time cannot be determined.
funcs.name: GetTime

methods.doc:
UnixTime converts t the number of seconds and nanoseconds using the Unix
epoch of 1 Jan 1970.
methods.name: UnixTime

types.doc:
A UUID is a 128 bit (16 byte) Universal Unique IDentifier as defined in RFC
4122.
types.name: UUID

funcs.doc:
NewDCEGroup returns a DCE Security (Version 2) UUID in the group
domain with the id returned by os.Getgid.

 NewDCEGroup(Group, uint32(os.Getgid()))
funcs.name: NewDCEGroup

funcs.doc:
NewDCEPerson returns a DCE Security (Version 2) UUID in the person
domain with the id returned by os.Getuid.

 NewDCEPerson(Person, uint32(os.Getuid()))
funcs.name: NewDCEPerson

funcs.doc:
NewDCESecurity returns a DCE Security (Version 2) UUID.

The domain should be one of Person, Group or Org.
On a POSIX system the id should be the users UID for the Person
domain and the users GID for the Group.  The meaning of id for
the domain Org or on non-POSIX systems is site defined.

For a given domain/id pair the same token may be returned for up to
7 minutes and 10 seconds.
funcs.name: NewDCESecurity

funcs.doc:
NewHash returns a new UUID dervied from the hash of space concatenated with
data generated by h.  The hash should be at least 16 byte in length.  The
first 16 bytes of the hash are used to form the UUID.  The version of the
UUID will be the lower 4 bits of version.  NewHash is used to implement
NewMD5 and NewSHA1.
funcs.name: NewHash

funcs.doc:
NewMD5 returns a new MD5 (Version 3) UUID based on the
supplied name space and data.

 NewHash(md5.New(), space, data, 3)
funcs.name: NewMD5

funcs.doc:
Random returns a Random (Version 4) UUID or panics.

The strength of the UUIDs is based on the strength of the crypto/rand
package.

A note about uniqueness derived from from the UUID Wikipedia entry:

 Randomly generated UUIDs have 122 random bits.  One's annual risk of being
 hit by a meteorite is estimated to be one chance in 17 billion, that
 means the probability is about 0.00000000006 (6 × 10−11),
 equivalent to the odds of creating a few tens of trillions of UUIDs in a
 year and having one duplicate.
funcs.name: NewRandom

funcs.doc:
NewSHA1 returns a new SHA1 (Version 5) UUID based on the
supplied name space and data.

 NewHash(sha1.New(), space, data, 5)
funcs.name: NewSHA1

funcs.doc:
NewUUID returns a Version 1 UUID based on the current NodeID and clock
sequence, and the current time.  If the NodeID has not been set by SetNodeID
or SetNodeInterface then it will be set automatically.  If the NodeID cannot
be set NewUUID returns nil.  If clock sequence has not been set by
SetClockSequence then it will be set automatically.  If GetTime fails to
return the current NewUUID returns nil.
funcs.name: NewUUID

funcs.doc:
Parse decodes s into a UUID or returns nil.  Both the UUID form of
xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx and
urn:uuid:xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx are decoded.
funcs.name: Parse

methods.doc:
ClockSequence returns the clock sequence encoded in uuid.  It returns false
if uuid is not valid.  The clock sequence is only well defined for version 1
and 2 UUIDs.
methods.name: ClockSequence

methods.doc: Domain returns the domain for a Version 2 UUID or false.
methods.name: Domain

methods.doc: Id returns the id for a Version 2 UUID or false.
methods.name: Id

methods.doc:
NodeID returns the 6 byte node id encoded in uuid.  It returns nil if uuid is
not valid.  The NodeID is only well defined for version 1 and 2 UUIDs.
methods.name: NodeID

methods.doc:
String returns the string form of uuid, xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx
, or "" if uuid is invalid.
methods.name: String

methods.doc:
Time returns the time in 100s of nanoseconds since 15 Oct 1582 encoded in
uuid.  It returns false if uuid is not valid.  The time is only well defined
for version 1 and 2 UUIDs.
methods.name: Time

methods.doc:
URN returns the RFC 2141 URN form of uuid,
urn:uuid:xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx,  or "" if uuid is invalid.
methods.name: URN

methods.doc:
Variant returns the variant encoded in uuid.  It returns Invalid if
uuid is invalid.
methods.name: Variant

methods.doc:
Version returns the verison of uuid.  It returns false if uuid is not
valid.
methods.name: Version

types.doc: A Variant represents a UUIDs variant.
types.name: Variant

types.doc: A Version represents a UUIDs version.
types.name: Version

vars.doc: Well known Name Space IDs and UUIDs

funcs.doc:
ClockSequence returns the current clock sequence, generating one if not
already set.  The clock sequence is only used for Version 1 UUIDs.

The uuid package does not use global static storage for the clock sequence or
the last time a UUID was generated.  Unless SetClockSequence a new random
clock sequence is generated the first time a clock sequence is requested by
ClockSequence, GetTime, or NewUUID.  (section 4.2.1.1) sequence is generated
for
funcs.name: ClockSequence

funcs.doc: Equal returns true if uuid1 and uuid2 are equal.
funcs.name: Equal

funcs.doc:
New returns a new random (version 4) UUID as a string.  It is a convenience
function for NewRandom().String().
funcs.name: New

funcs.doc:
NodeID returns a slice of a copy of the current Node ID, setting the Node ID
if not already set.
funcs.name: NodeID

funcs.doc:
NodeInterface returns the name of the interface from which the NodeID was
derived.  The interface "user" is returned if the NodeID was set by
SetNodeID.
funcs.name: NodeInterface

funcs.doc:
SetClockSeq sets the clock sequence to the lower 14 bits of seq.  Setting to
-1 causes a new sequence to be generated.
funcs.name: SetClockSequence

funcs.doc:
SetNodeID sets the Node ID to be used for Version 1 UUIDs.  The first 6 bytes
of id are used.  If id is less than 6 bytes then false is returned and the
Node ID is not set.
funcs.name: SetNodeID

funcs.doc:
SetNodeInterface selects the hardware address to be used for Version 1 UUIDs.
If name is "" then the first usable interface found will be used or a random
Node ID will be generated.  If a named interface cannot be found then false
is returned.

SetNodeInterface never fails when name is "".
funcs.name: SetNodeInterface

funcs.doc:
SetRand sets the random number generator to r, which implents io.Reader.
If r.Read returns an error when the package requests random data then
a panic will be issued.

Calling SetRand with nil sets the random number generator to the default
generator.
funcs.name: SetRand

funcs.doc:
TestClockSeqRace tests for a particular race condition of returning two
identical Version1 UUIDs.  The duration of 1 minute was chosen as the race
condition, before being fixed, nearly always occured in under 30 seconds.
funcs.name: TestClockSeqRace
